Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.15482931]HIV-1:Inhibition of 3′-processing catalyzed by integrase(IC50=185 µM);inhibition of strand transfer catalyzed by integrase(IC50=215 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: The HIV-1 integrase plays a crucial role in the HIV-1 virus replication cycle. The peptide can inhibit the activity of integrase and thus inhibit virus replication.

Literature.Title: Synthesis and HIV-1 integrase inhibitory activity of dimeric and tetrameric analogs of indolicidin.
Literature.Author: Krajewski K, Marchand C, Long YQ, Pommier Y, Roller PP.
